clinical_study.brief_title: Visual Acuity After the Combined Binocular Implantation of +2.0 Diopters and +3.0 Diopters Oculentis Multifocal Intraocular Lenses.
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of the Visual Acuity After the Implantation of an Oculentis +2.0 Diopters (Torical) Bifocal Intraocular Lens (MplusX (Toric) LU-313 MF20T/LS-313 MF20) in the Distance Dominant Eye, in Combination With a +3.0 Diopters Oculentis Bifocal Intraocular Lens (MplusX (Toric) LU-313 MF30T/LS-313 MF30) in the Fellow Eye.

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this study is to assess the visual outcome after the combined binocular implantation of +2.0 D and +3.0 D refractive multifocal intraocular lenses.

detailed_description.textblock: Bifocal multifocal intraocular lenses (MIOL) are effective in achieving good uncorrected visual acuities in the distance and the near. However, the intermediate vision is of increasing relevance for everyday's life. Several multifocal intraocular lenses have been developed to improvement intermediate vision. Nonetheless, those systems still possess adverse photic effects and do not garantuee spectacle independence. Therefore, the combination of a lower-addition bifocal intraocular lense in the distance-dominant eye with a higher-addition bifocal intraocular lense in the fellow-eye might be a promising approach to address these drawbacks of current binocular and trifocal intraocular lenses.

primary_outcome.measure: Visual acuities in the far, intermediate and near
primary_outcome.description: Visual acuities are tested under photopic conditions at 5 m, intermediate (80 cm) and patient-preferred near distance (≈ 40 cm).

primary_outcome.measure: Visual acuities in the far, intermediate and near
primary_outcome.description: Visual acuities are tested under photopic conditions at 5 m, intermediate (80 cm) and patient-preferred near distance (≈ 40 cm).
Mesopic visual acuities are tested under high-contrast, low-contrast and low-contrast with glare.
Mesopic visual acuities are tested under high-contrast, low-contrast and low-contrast with glare.
Scotopic contrast sensitivity are tested at 0.1 cd/m2, 0.032 cd/m2 and 0.1 cd/m2 with glare.
Scotopic contrast sensitivity are tested at 0.1 cd/m2, 0.032 cd/m2 and 0.1 cd/m2 with glare.

secondary_outcome.measure: Spectacle independence in the far, intermediate and near
secondary_outcome.description: Spectacle independence as stated by the patient.

intervention.intervention_name: Binocular cataract surgery with phacoemulsification and implantation of multifocal intraocular lenses
intervention.description: Binocular implantation of the combination of Oculentis® MplusX® multifocal intraocular lenses with an addition of +2.0 D in the distance-dominant eye and +3.0 D in the fellow eye.
intervention.other_name: Oculentis® MplusX® multifocal intraocular lenses with an addition of +2.0 D (LU-313 MF20T/LS-313 MF20) and +3.0 D (LU-313 MF30T/LS-313 MF30) are used.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- clinically significant cataract
- endothelial cell count: patients aged 18-75 years: > 1000 cells/mm2; patients > 75 years: > 750 cells/mm2
- absence of vision-limiting corneal or retinal comorbidities
- capability to understand the informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- expected postoperative astigmatism > 0.75 diopters
- irregular astigmatism
- dilated pupil diameter < 3 mm
- corneal and fundus abnormalities that might cause visual impairments
- inability to attend follow-up visits

overall_official.affiliation: Charité - University Medicine Berlin, Department of Ophthalmology

facility.name: Charité - University Medicine Berlin, Department of Ophthalmology
